comments.commentBody: I am Cuban too, and I did not run but fought: Don't be ridiculous.
My question is wether one of the requirements of his job is Drug Testing.  I only mention that s because of the time of day and bizzare nature of his tweets.

I won't pass judgment at this point without evidence either way. But one thing is certain: Former president Obama, with NDAA 2012 and his unleashing of the NSA's massive surveillance of almost everybody and everything, created a monster.
As one of my most admired presidents, Harry Truman, said: "The buck stops here" meaning the oval office.
It would sort of be like being asked to prove that there's wind blowing without being able to point to the moving trees as proof.
It's just another one of Trump's hiccups. Deflect, deflect deflect. That is all he does. he probably did the same thing when he was a child in order to get out of trouble. It's tiresome, really.
Trump, thought, and reasoned action are not words that can be combined in the same sentence. He is dangerously off the reservation when it comes to reason and survival of humanity in the world.

I have sent President Obama several messages encourageing him not to retire from electoral politics but instead to establish residence in a congressional district currently represented by a Republican and to run for the House in 2018.  I hope that the current president's absurd, obscene attacks on his predecessor might spur Obama to this kind of action. His presence in the midterm race could help turn it into a national referendum on Trump and drive Democratic turnout like no one has seen in an off-year election ever before.

There has been speculation that Trump suffers from Narcissistic Personality Disorder (NPD). People with NPD are sometimes mistaken for paranoid schizophrenics, because their behaviors can appear similar. However, the two mental illnesses are really different. In its most extreme state, someone with NPD can devolve into paranoia. Trump's accusation of "sick," which has occurred in previous tweets (not only this particular one), can be viewed as a projection of one's fears for oneself onto another, and is probably the most distinctive characteristic associated with NPD.
Of course Trump Tower is wire tapped as is the White House, and my house and your house...Where were you people during the sixties??  Do you think  they removed all that hardware?!?
Love your name!
Forget the involved analysis, the guy is a pathological liar, con artist and just plain nuts.  End of discussion.

The most talented screen writer in Hollywood couldn't come up with the insanity our country has been infested with regarding the rump and his crowd of cretins. Just when you think the insanity couldn't get any worse, the orange one opens his mouth and bile pours out like an execrable Niagara Falls. Is this what we're going to try to survive for the next 4 years!! I know for a fact I'm not going to be able to make it! I'm going to have to stop watching news shows, reading publications and talking with people! Or I'm going to have to do whatever I can to stop this insane group of Voldemort's disciples by participating in demonstrations, writing letters/emails, and never voting for anyone who supports the rump! What we have in the WH is nothing short of those who have flown over the coo coo's nests!!!

This issue thus begs the question whether BHO has grounds to sue DJT for libel if in fact the allegations are false.

Seems to me if that's the case then it would be quite easy for BHO to prevail.

Which further leads me to believe that DJT's accusations are in fact accurate.
As Lindsay Graham said today - if Obama, a constitutional lawyer - legally obtained a wire tap from FISA - then a libel suit is the least of Trumps worries.
Well, hold on. Obama may sue him for defamation. Wouldn't that be grand!!?!?
Okay, you are just not making any sense.

This is the person we are supposed to lead us in case of a national emergency? This is the person we are supposed to trust? This is the person who has the sole responsibility to make the final decision to launch a nuclear warhead? This is the person? This is the person?!

CONGRESS ACT!!

Let's look at the long view of the past. The Congressional Republicans made a strategy of leading the nation with hatred and anger. They found it gets the voters to the polls to vote for them. It has worked thus far for several elections. Then along comes a salesman who saw that strategy and used it to get elected. Now he is still using hatred and anger to win people's following. It's a familiar recurring strategy in human history and it never ends well. Be prepared Democrats.

R Nathan--He READ (not very well) a speech, he did not write, promoting the same stupid ideas, without yelling.  That is NOT "presidential," and corporate news sources who say it is, are attempting to not offend any conservative viewers they may have, as well as APPEAR to be "trump-neutral."  They should all grow several pairs.
No, the CEO can't. You have to respect the 1st amendment. No matter how idiotic Trump is.

I want to correct you on something. Barack Obama "avoided anything that had a hint of scandal" because Barack Obama is a good, decent, honest man--period. He didn't have to make any effort. It's who he is.

Take some time to read either of the books he wrote in the years before he became President of this country and you will understand this. I wish this country understood the essential intelligence and dignity of Barack Obama. Too many people only saw his race. So very sad, and it reflects badly on us as a nation.

So, no, Barack Obama would never order an illegal wiretap.
Nor did Obama mention tin foil hats, either.
"...during the very sacred election process." Really? I wonder how Vlad is doing on the Hillary e mail hunt Trump asked for.
Wasn't the election "rigged?"

I would not be that familiar with Putin to just call him Vlad, first name terms almost. Let us just call him Vladimir Trump.
The spoiled child will always come up with some new thing; oh he did it to me and I know it. "He took my toys and I am so upset now". "He tapped my phone when I was talking to Vladimir"
This is so funny, not
hey, nyt, you need to call a lie a lie- stop enabling this behavior- this is "fake news" generated by the "fake news president".

Trump? Proof? Not going to happen.

He just says what he thinks will play best. If he doesn't know what to say, he simply invents something, or reverses the meaning of some fact, and promotes the opposition of what is reasonable and true.

A dangerously selfish man enabled by a wannabe kleptocracy, bent on creating conflict and hatred around the world.

What could go wrong?
We're aboard a ship of fools. We REALLY need to fix our public education system.

Plays out like this:
If there is a FISA warrant Trump responds by saying he was spied on by Obama.
If there was no FISA warrant secured, Trump responds by saying he was spied upon illegally.
Win/win for Trump and mIsdirection from the Russians.
I really hope you're right!

Naturally, with access to the most sensitive eyes-only classified material on the planet and a wealth of intelligent and informed military, law enforcement, foreign affairs experts, and legal advisors just a phone call away, Trump instead reaches for...Breitbart.
You are not the only one tuning out.

Now, NY Times, are you not ashamed of yourselves for the way you reported on President Trump's speech to a joint session of Congress? We have seen this act before, when he gave a similar speech before a teleprompter to a foreign policy group during his campaign. But the leopard does not change his spots. Once in a while he gets caught in front of a camouflaging background.

To the extent he has any extraordinary talent it is an actor who can act presidential in the right setting. We all know his attacks on president Obama have been made for one reason only, to deflect from the Russia inquiry. I recall when he and his team said it made no difference where Podesta's emails came from-it was their substance that mattered. President Trump has never needed facts to attack anyone, nor does he care whom he attacks. President Lincoln will probably be next,

Let's keep the focus where it belongs-on a horrible, corrupt man with no policy other than to keep himself in office or make himself a dictator. There is no low to which he will not go. Do not be distracted by his "presidential" performances. "Russiagate" is upon us.
